fi.javalabra.logic

Class Blocks

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.javalabra.logic.Blocks

  • public class Blocks
extends Object
    This class wraps up all the blocks to a linked structure
    Author:
    jola

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Blocks()
      Constructor for Blocks-instance

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteCurrent()
      Delete the block which was last time returned by getNext() or getPrev()
      Block getFirst()
      Get the first block on the list
      Block getLast()
      Get the last block on the list
      boolean getLocked()
      Get the lock state if you wish to check if the blocks-instance is already being used by other concurrent routine

      Get the next block on the list.
      Block getPrev()
      Get the previous block on the list.

      Insert a block to the list
      void lock()
      Set lock state to true
      void nullifyBlockList()
      Nullifies the block list and sets everything to default.
      void rewind()
      Rewind the list pointer to null.
      int size()
      Get the length of the list
      void unlock()
      Set lock state to false

        public Blocks()

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(Block block)
        Insert a block to the list
        Parameters:
        block - the block to be inserted

      • deleteCurrent

        public void deleteCurrent()
        Delete the block which was last time returned by getNext() or getPrev()

      • getFirst

        public Block getFirst()
        Get the first block on the list
        Returns:
        the first block on the list

      • getLast

        public Block getLast()
        Get the last block on the list
        Returns:
        last block on the list

      • getNext

        public Block getNext()
        Get the next block on the list. If not called before, or rewind() has been called since the last call or end of the list was reached, returns the first element on the list.
        Returns:
        the next element on the list, or null after the last element, but first after that

      • getPrev

        public Block getPrev()
        Get the previous block on the list. If not called before, or rewind() has been called since the last call or the start of the list was reached, returns the last element on the list.
        Returns:
        the previous element on the list, or null after the first element, but last after that

      • rewind

        public void rewind()
        Rewind the list pointer to null. This will cause the next getNext() call to return the first element and the next getPrev() call to return the last element.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the length of the list
        Returns:
        the length of the list

      • getLocked

        public boolean getLocked()
        Get the lock state if you wish to check if the blocks-instance is already being used by other concurrent routine
        Returns:
        the lock state, true if locked

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Set lock state to true

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Set lock state to false

      • nullifyBlockList

        public void nullifyBlockList()
        Nullifies the block list and sets everything to default.
